title: Your Thursday Briefing: U.S. Believes Ukrainians Were Behind a Killing in Russia
description: Plus arming Taiwan to deter China and OPEC cuts oil production.

title: Climate Change Made Summer Hotter and Drier Worldwide, Study Finds
description: Europe, China and North America were parched by extreme heat that would have been ‘virtually impossible’ without the effects of global warming, scientists said.

title: Unveiled and Furious: How Iran’s Women-Led Protests Cut to the Heart of National Identity
description: The hijabs women are forced to wear have long been a sign of the government’s power. Now, the women-led protests have made them a symbol of a clashing vision of Iran’s future.

title: Danish Queen Apologizes After Stripping Royal Titles From 4 Grandchildren
description: Prince Joachim, the youngest of Queen Margrethe II’s two sons, has four children who will be affected by the change, which the queen said was “a necessary future-proofing of the monarchy.”

title: Jerzy Urban, Acerbic Communist Turned Free-Speech Hero, Dies at 89
description: He spent the 1980s as the Polish regime’s sarcastic spokesman, then transformed himself into a controversial media entrepreneur in the ’90s.

title: U.S. Believes Ukraine Was Behind an Assassination in Russia
description: American officials said they were not aware of the plan ahead of time for the attack that killed Daria Dugina and that they had admonished Ukraine over it.

title: In Israel, a Solemn Yom Kippur Also Creates a Giant Playground
description: Yom Kippur, the holiest day in Judaism, brings Israel to a standstill. For the nonobservant, that briefly turns highways into bike trails.

title: Baquer Namazi, Held by Iran for 7 Years, Is Released
description: The Iranian American is heading to the United Arab Emirates for urgent medical care.

title: Russian Journalist Who Protested War Escapes House Arrest
description: Marina Ovsyannikova said in a Telegram post that she considered herself innocent of the two-month sentence imposed by a Moscow court.

title: Biden Administration Pushes Oil Producers to Keep Production High
description: U.S. officials have been in talks with oil-producing countries in an effort to prevent global oil prices from rising sharply.

title: Liz Truss Promises U.K. Rapid Change
description: Britain’s beleaguered new prime minister weathered a protest during her set-piece annual speech to deliver an uncompromising message.

title: Japan expels a Russian diplomat, a retaliatory move as relations deteriorate.
Putin Signs Annexation Laws as Russia Loses Ground in Ukraine
description: Russian state television trumpeted the news, while playing down or ignoring the fact that Moscow’s forces are in retreat in multiple parts of the front line.

title: Balancing Extremes
description: The Federal Reserve is trying to tame inflation without wrecking the economy.

title: Australia Aims to Cut Its High Rate of Species Extinctions to Zero
description: The country plans to focus on 110 endangered species and 20 habitats, but experts said the initiative was only a start.

title: A new package of U.S. military aid will speed more mobile rocket launchers to Ukraine.
Philippines Lottery Draw Produced 433 Winners. Was It Pure Luck?
description: The result of a lotto drawing in the Philippines has set off a national debate about randomness, probability, fraud and human nature.

title: E.U. Negotiators Strike Deal on Russian Oil Price Cap
description: The cap, championed by the United States, would deprive the Kremlin of tens of billions of dollars annually. Experts warn that implementation will be difficult.

title: U.S. Aims to Turn Taiwan Into Giant Weapons Depot
description: Officials say Taiwan needs to become a “porcupine” with enough weapons to hold out if the Chinese military blockades and invades it, even if Washington decides to send troops.

title: What Does Sustainable Living Look Like? Maybe Like Uruguay
description: No greater challenge faces humanity than reducing emissions without backsliding into preindustrial poverty. One tiny country is leading the way.

title: Nobel Prize in Chemistry to Be Awarded Today
description: The third Nobel awarded this year, it is the week’s final science prize.

title: OPEC Members and Russia Set to Meet as Europe Faces Energy Crisis
description: Saudi Arabia appears determined to bolster prices and continue coordinating with Russia during the Ukraine war.

title: Russians Fleeing the Draft Find an Unlikely Haven in Kyrgyzstan
description: Tens of thousands of men have ended up in places like Kyrgyzstan, a former Soviet territory, that normally see few refugees but are willing to take them.

title: After the Storm, the Mold: Warming Is Worsening Another Costly Disaster
description: Mold in homes is a costly crisis that often accompanies hurricanes and flooding, and climate change is amplifying the rain that feeds outbreaks.
